content:
Yes, Sting's contributions to The Emperor's New Groove were a bit of a departure for him, but added a unique flair to the film's soundtrack. There have been several other rock stars and musicians who have worked with Disney on their animated films, here are a few more examples:

1. Aerosmith - they recorded the song "Walk This Way" for the film Herbie Fully Loaded.

2. David Bowie - he provided the voice of Jareth the Goblin King in Labyrinth, which was produced by Jim Henson Productions and released by Tri-Star Pictures (now part of the Sony Pictures division of the Sony Corporation).

3. Jon Bon Jovi - he recorded the song "Blaze of Glory" for the film Young Guns II, which was also included on his solo album of the same name.

4. Bette Midler - she provided the voice of Georgette the poodle in Oliver & Company, and also sang "Perfect Isn't Easy" for the film.

5. Freddie Mercury - he recorded the song "Time" for the film Time, which was just over ten minutes long and was also included on his solo album Barcelona.

These musicians, along with many others, have added their talents to Disney films over the years, bringing their unique styles and sounds to beloved characters and stories.
